title: This "Skill based champ" insult is really getting on my nerves.

replies.body:
Well you can't blame em for it lol...

-> Spint at enemy champ
-> Silence
-> Spin
-> Run back to farm minions and regen with passive until combo is back up 
-> Repeat for definite lane phase win

While Garen is super fkin easy to stomp lane with there's the problem that if you come across someone who isn't a clueless idiot then you're gonna be made useless throughout the entire game and put your team into a 4v5 situation.
Honestly, I think Garen is the worst late game champion in the game save for his silence. Not enough CC and low damage tank aside from ult. Although he is one tanky %%%%.

hes a tank, suppose to start the team fights, save people with he's silence, do not much damage but also be unstoppable, he is really strong late game if you ask me, I've played a few and some are %%%% but if you know how to play him late then woah, he's strong and also a b*tch to kill :/

His engage isn't the greatest compared to other tanks. His engage is literally running at the enemy. He's an early game champ that does a lot of damage, he transitions into a silence machine late game.

thats true, but if you build sun fire and thorn mail then you have etrxa damage done to them as you run in, also he's e can be used while walking out and hes silence is good for team fights cause of its cool down, he is op but also not at the same time, a good garen can win lane with ease but also saying that anyone good at a champ can go win lane with ease. kinda now depends on the player and not really the champ, every champ is op in their own way now.

Garen is a pretty linear champion (hence why he's recommended for new players) he has a very simple build path. Garen excels at running into or at enemy teams but once he's in there he either dies in seconds because he's going crit or he does nothing except shred armour and execute a target that was already going to die. Garen is extremely easy to win lane with, he doesn't have a lot of counters aside from anyone ranged. But you're right, if no one gets a Last Whisper, Black Cleaver or isn't playing Jarvan, Garen will be so darn unkillable.
I heard the same thing when I mained Master Yi before I even hit Level 20 >.>

You just have to not worry about what others say (if you do you will spend every day on this game in tears) 
its just fact that some champs are easier to do well with than others, you just have to accept that and move on, (i dont play garen so i dunno how hard he is to play) but if garen is your favourite champ and you love everything about him then play him no matter what anyone says! but if you play him just because he is the only champ you get good scores with then what they are saying is true and you should consider playing other champs.
i personally just play champs i like whether they are op or not. 
anyway the crux of the matter is; people get mad when they lose and will think of any reason to blame everything other than themselves and if your champ is considered easy then they will use that as an excuse for their own shortcomings. i play Azir who is considered pretty hard to play and if i do well the enemy team says "%%%% your bs champ riot wtf so broken" and when i play badly my own team says "wtf azir pick a real champ he is useless" so whatever you do you're gunna get rage it doesn't matter what champ you play so just play one that you like and put up with it.

however what you said at the end makes no sense, "if you get kills you obviously don't need to play a 'skill based champ' but noooo."
getting lots of kills all the time means you have mastered that particular champ and should move on to one that is more challenging for you.
its like maths at school if you get good at year 5 maths you move on to year 6 next year, it doesn't mean you should sit at year 5 maths lvl for the rest of your life just because you are good at it.
it doesn't take much skill to press q then right click an adc, and then press r to use your point and click execute when they're low though.
When people dont know how to play against a certain match up, or dont know wht the hell they r doing. They tend to say easy champ.

People assume that there are no skills involved in point and click champs (in this case though let us ignore Ryze and Akali's existence for the time being) or those who lacks versatile positions and mechanisms,

But the same people praise and worship the overloaded cancers because they're needlessly flashy when in play,

Which one requires more skill to be "effective", in other words, where are more skills required? Well we already know the answer.

Or you can also say, most of the champs are of similar skill, but where the skill is deployed is different.

> [{quoted}](name=SEKAI,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=EH9JsWZ4,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2014-12-27T08:08:24.907+0000)
>
> People assume that there are no skills involved in point and click champs (in this case though let us ignore Ryze and Akali's existence for the time being) or those who lacks versatile positions and mechanisms,

> Or you can also say, most of the champs are of similar skill, but where the skill is deployed is different.

Don't bring Akali into it, she's not even close to Ryze or Garen, sure her skillfloor is low, but her skillcap is high, it takes a lot of time to actually master her, Garen and Ryze both has a low skillcap.

Salty people get angry when they die to point and click champs. Simple. I play a lot of Nasus and hear the same thing. I just go with it, "you like my mechanics? Pressing Q and right clicking better than you"

It's just annoying that a champ they think sucks kills them.

I get the same way when an Akali jumps on me though... very annoying
